sen.j: 石上 家成（いそのかみ の いえなり、養老_(元号)6年（722年）- 延暦23年6月20日_(旧暦)（804年8月3日））は、奈良時代から平安時代初期にかけての官人。
sen.e: ISONOKAMI no Ienari (722 - August 3, 804) was a government official who lived from the Nara period to the beginning of the Heian period.

sen.j: 左大臣石上麻呂の孫で正六位上石上東人の子。
sen.e: He was a grandson of Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) ISONOKAMI no Maro and was a son of ISONOKAMI no Azumabito (東人), who was at the rank of Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade).
sen.cmt: 「東人」の正式な読み方は不明です。人名の場合の最も一般的と思われる読みを採用しました。

sen.j: 父が低い身分のうちに早世したために、左大臣の孫でありながら、外官に叙された。
sen.e: As his father died young before obtaining a high position, he started his career with a local government official despite the fact that he was a grandson of the Sadaijin.

sen.e: In 768, he was appointed the Governor of Kazusa Province and a Junior Assistant Minister of Edicts.

sen.j: 宝亀年間に入ると、従五位上から正五位下に進み、民部省・宮内省を経て天応 (日本)元年には従四位下民部省に昇った。
sen.e: Once the Hoki era began, he was promoted to Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) from Jugoinoge, and after he experienced a Junior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs and a Senior Assistant Minister of the Sovereign's Household, he became a Senior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs with the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) in 781.

sen.j: この年、権官大納言の石上宅嗣（家成の従兄弟）が没したため、石上氏の事実上の氏長上となるが、外官出身が災いして議政官になることは無かった。
sen.e: In that year, Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state) ISONOKAMI no Yakatsugu (who was a cousin of Ienari) died and Ienari practically became the head of the Isonokami clan, but he never joined the Giseikan (legislature) because he started his career with a local government officer.

sen.j: その後、大宰府や衛門府、内蔵寮、宮内省などを務めて従三位に列したが、散位官のまま死去した。
sen.e: Afterward, he was granted the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) after several positions such as a Junior Assistant Governor-General of Dazai-fu (the local government office in the Kyushu region), a Captain Gate guard, the Chief of Bureau of Palace Storehouses, and the Minister of the Sovereign's Household, but he did not have any official positions when he died.

sen.j: 父親の身分の極端な低さや仕事は精勤するもののそれ以上の才が無かった事から公卿には昇ってもついに要職を任される事無く没した。
sen.e: Although he became a Court noble, he was never appointed any key positions while he was alive, because his father was in a lower rank, and additionally, he was serious about his work but not so talented.
